sub_title: Full Professor Intelligent Energy Systems at Eindhoven University of Technology
summary:
Koen Kok is a scientific researcher in the interdisciplinary field of intelligent electricity systems, combining electrical engineering and control engineering with computational intelligence. Currently, Koen is Full Professor Electrical Power Systems at the Eindhoven University of Technology (TU/e).

Kok has extensive research experience in the fields of market-based control of power systems, smart grid ICT architectures, transactive energy and integration of distributed energy resources and demand response in the electricity system. Key results have been field deployed and commercialized.

Specialties: Smart Grids, Intelligent Electricity Systems, Integration of Renewable Energy and Distributed Energy Resources, ICT-architectures, Multi-agent systems, Market-based Control, Business Cases and Market Models for Smart Electricity, Electricity Wholesale Markets, PowerMatcher, Technology Transfer.
